Class CPNSubNetFigure

java.lang.Object
  org.rakiura.draw.AbstractFigure
      org.rakiura.draw.figure.AttributeFigure
          org.rakiura.draw.figure.RectangleFigure
              org.rakiura.cpn.gui.CPNSubNetFigure

java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.util.EventListener, CPNAbstractFigure, CPNAbstractNetFigure, NetListener, org.rakiura.draw.Figure, org.rakiura.draw.ParentFigure
public class CPNSubNetFigure
extends org.rakiura.draw.figure.RectangleFigure
implements CPNAbstractNetFigure, NetListener

Figure representing a CPN sub net.

Constructor Detail

CPNSubNetFigure

public CPNSubNetFigure(NetDrawing aNetDrawing)
Creates a new subnetfigure for the subnetdrawing. Use this for example if you are adding a net+drawing to an other net as a subnet. The subnetfigure will have the name, drawing and annotations of the subnetdrawing and the net therein.

Parameters:
aNetDrawing - the netdrawing

CPNSubNetFigure

public CPNSubNetFigure(Net aNet,
                       java.util.Map superPlacesMap,
                       NetDrawing parentDrawing)
Creates a new SubNetFigure with the provided SubNet to listen to. This constructor is useful if you are creating a new drawing for a given net. Except for the aNet argument, all arguments should be null or they should represent the super figure that contains this subnetfigure and all fake connection figures are drawn in the subnet and the supernet. The transition is a green rectangle with the size equal to size Above the rectangle the name is displayed in bold. The display of the name can be switched off.

Parameters:
aNet - a Net that is to be displayed by this CPNSubNetFigure
superPlacesMap - if the subnetfigure is created from a subnet, this map should contain the places of the supernet it belongs to, so that all fake arcs and places can be drawn properly. Otherwise it should be null.
parentDrawing - The drawing that contains this subnet figure. Used to draw the fake arcs. Use Null if there are no fake arcs to draw.
See Also:
setNameVisible(boolean)

CPNSubNetFigure

protected CPNSubNetFigure(Net aNet)
Creates a new SubNetFigure from the provided Net. Creates no netdrawing!

Parameters:
aNet - the net.

getNetElement

public NetElement getNetElement()
Clones this net. Clone has same name, but different ID

Specified by:
getNetElement in interface CPNAbstractFigure
Returns:
clone of this net. public Object clone() { final CPNSubNetFigure clone = (CPNSubNetFigure) super.clone(); clone.setNetElement (this.net.clone()); clone.name = new CPNNameFigure (clone); clone.imports = new CPNAnnotationFigure(CPNAnnotationFigure.IMPORT, clone); clone.declaration = new CPNAnnotationFigure(CPNAnnotationFigure.DECLARATION, clone); clone.implement = new CPNAnnotationFigure(CPNAnnotationFigure.IMPLEMENTS, clone); clone.name.moveBy(-25, -25); clone.imports.moveBy(10, -8); clone.declaration.moveBy(-10, -8); clone.implement.moveBy(0, -8); clone.createNetDrawing(null, null); return clone; }

setNetElement

public void setNetElement(NetElement aNetElement)
Sets the subnet element for this subnet. It does not create a new drawing to reflect the new subnet, nor does it set the net to the drawing.

Specified by:
setNetElement in interface CPNAbstractFigure
Parameters:
aNetElement - the subnet.

setNetDrawing

public void setNetDrawing(NetDrawing newNetDrawing)
Sets the netdrawing to the new netdrawing and dereferences the old drawing. The net reference is not changed!

Parameters:
newNetDrawing - a net drawing. It should reflect the net element that is represented by this figure.

addArc

public void addArc(CPNArcFigure arcFigure,
                   CPNPlaceFigure placeFigure,
                   int type)
Adds the arc to the subnet. The caller of this method has to make sure the arc is not part of an other drawing and a fake Arc is drawn in the original drawing

Parameters:
arcFigure - An arcFigure to add to the drawing and to connect to a transition
placeFigure - the placeFigure to virtually connect to
type - the type of the arc (input/output)

deReference

public void deReference()
Makes sure that the figure does not listen to a netElement anymore. Use it if a figure is not displayed anymore. e.g. when the drawing is closed.

Specified by:
deReference in interface CPNAbstractFigure
See Also:
CPNAbstractFigure.reReference()

reReference

public void reReference()
Makes sure that the figure does listen to its netElement again. Use it if a figure is displayed again. e.g. when a drawing is redisplayed.

Specified by:
reReference in interface CPNAbstractFigure
See Also:
CPNAbstractFigure.deReference()
